post.description: The Create Session API allows you to generate a url for a specific workflow where your users can start verifying their identity.

session_number.description: Sequential number assigned to the session.

session_token.description: Token used to access the verification flow URL.

vendor_data.description: Identifier provided by the vendor for tracking.

metadata.description: Additional data associated with the session.

status.description: Current status of the verification session.

workflow_id.description: Identifier of the workflow used for the session.

callback.description: Callback URL to redirect the user after completion.

url.description: URL for the user to complete the verification flow.

value.detail: You don't have enough credits to perform this request. Please top up at https://business.didit.me
You do not have permission to perform this action.

parameters.name: x-api-key
parameters.description: The API Key for your application. You can obtain it by following the [Quick Start Guide](/reference/quick-start#/).

workflow_id.description: The verification workflow to use. You can check how to create a custom workflow and obtain the workflow_id in the [Workflows](/identity-verification/workflows) page.

vendor_data.description: A unique identifier for the vendor or user, such as a UUID or email. This field enables proper session tracking and user data aggregation across multiple verification sessions.

callback.description: URL to redirect the user after verification completes. Didit automatically appends `verificationSessionId` and `status` (Approved, Declined, In Review) as query parameters.

metadata.description: Additional data to store with the session not displayed to the user. For example: `{"user_type": "premium", "account_id": "ABC123"}`.

language.description: Language code (ISO 639-1) for the verification process interface. Controls the language displayed to the end user during verification. If not provided, the browser's language will be automatically detected and used. Check all the supported languages [here](/reference/supported-languages).

contact_details.description: User contact information that can be used for notifications, prefilling verification forms, and phone verification. This includes email address, preferred language for communications, and phone number.

email.description: Email address of the user (e.g., "john.doe@example.com") that will be used during the [Email Verification](/identity-verification/email-verification/how-it-works) step. If not provided, the user must provide it during the verification flow.

send_notification_emails.description: If true, sends verification status notifications for sessions requiring manual review to the provided email address (e.g., from 'In Review' to 'Approved' or 'Declined'). This helps users return to your application once their verification is complete. If you have white-label activated for the session, the email sent will be white-labeled.

email_lang.description: Language code (ISO 639-1) for email notifications. Controls the language of all email communications (e.g., "en", "es", "fr"). All the supported languages can be found [here](/identity-verification/supported-languages)

phone.description: Phone number in E.164 format (e.g., "+14155552671") that will be used during the [Phone Verification](/identity-verification/phone-verification/how-it-works) step. If not provided, the user must provide it during the verification flow.

expected_details.description: Expected user details for cross-validation with extracted verification data.

date_of_birth.description: User's date of birth with format: YYYY-MM-DD. For example, `1990-05-15`.

gender.description: User's gender. Must be either 'M', 'F', or null.

nationality.description: ISO 3166-1 alpha-3 country code representing the applicant's country of origin. For example, `USA`.

country.description: ISO 3166-1 alpha-3 country code representing the country of the Proof of Address document, or the country of the applicant's ID document, which may differ from nationality. For example, `GBR`.

address.description: The address in a human readable format, including as much information as possible. For example, `123 Main St, San Francisco, CA 94105, USA`.

identification_number.description: The user's document number, personal number, or tax number. For example, `123456789`.

ip_address.description: Expected IP address for the session. If the actual IP address differs from this value, a warning will be logged. For example, `192.168.1.100`.

portrait_image.description: A Base64 encoded portrait image of the user's face, with a maximum size of 1MB. This image is only required for `Biometric Authentication` workflow types that have face match active to perform facial matching against the face captured during the liveness check.

get.description: The Retrieve Session API allows you to retrieve the results of a verification session.

id_verification.formatted_address: Avda de Madrid 34, Madrid, Madrid 28822, Spain

warnings.long_description: The system couldn't find or read the QR code on the document, which is necessary for document verification. This could be due to poor image quality or an unsupported document type.

certificate_summary.issuer: Common Name: CSCA SPAIN, Serial Number: 3, Organization: DIRECCION GENERAL DE LA POLICIA, Country: ES
certificate_summary.subject: Common Name: DS n-eID SPAIN 2, Organizational Unit: PASSPORT, Organization: DIRECCION GENERAL DE LA POLICIA, Country: ES

warnings.short_description: OCR and NFC mrz code extracted are not the same
warnings.long_description: The Optical Character Recognition (OCR) data and the NFC chip data don't match, indicating potential document tampering or data inconsistency.
The liveness check resulted in a low score, indicating potential use of non-live facial representations or poor-quality biometric data.
The facial features of the provided image don't closely match the reference image, suggesting a potential identity mismatch.

breaches.name: TAPAirPortugal
breaches.description: In August 2022, the Portuguese airline TAP Air Portugal was the target of a ransomware attack perpetrated by the Ragnar Locker gang who later leaked the compromised data via a public dark web site. Over 5M unique email addresses were exposed alongside other personal data including names, genders, DoBs, phone numbers and physical addresses.

warnings.long_description: This email address was found in one or more known data breaches.

poa.poa_formatted_address: Av. Monseñor Tavella 3396, A4400 Salta, Argentina

questionnaire.title: Source of Funds
questionnaire.description: Reply to this questionnaire to help us understand the source of funds.

items.title: What is your primary source of funds?
Provide details of the primary source.
items.description: e.g., employer/company name, role, industry, business nature, asset sold, date of inheritance/gift, etc.

items.title: What is your annual income range (pre-tax)?
What is your approximate net worth (range)?
For your initial deposit/funding, indicate the exact source and amount.
items.description: e.g., 'salary from ACME Ltd – July 2025 payroll'

items.title: Will any funds originate from third parties? If yes, please provide details.
Do you hold or plan to use virtual assets (e.g., crypto) to fund this account? If yes, please provide details.
Upload a proof of funds document
items.description: You can upload your three (3) most recent bank statements, three (3) most recent payslips, your most recent tax return, proof of company ownership, trading exchange statement, sale of property, or proof of inheritance.

items.title: Would you like to add any details to help us expedite our review of the documents you submitted?
items.description: You may provide any additional information or context regarding your uploaded documents.

session_id.description: The unique identifier of the session for which to retrieve verification results.

workflow_id.description: The unique identifier of the workflow for which to retrieve verification results.

vendor_data.description: The vendor data of the session.

expected_details.description: Expected user details for cross-validation with extracted verification data.

date_of_birth.description: User's date of birth with format: YYYY-MM-DD. For example, `1990-05-15`.

gender.description: User's gender. Must be either 'M', 'F', or null.

nationality.description: ISO 3166-1 alpha-3 country code representing the applicant's country of origin. For example, `USA`.

country.description: ISO 3166-1 alpha-3 country code representing the country of the Proof of Address document, or the country of the applicant's ID document, which may differ from nationality. For example, `GBR`.

address.description: The address in a human readable format, including as much information as possible. For example, `123 Main St, San Francisco, CA 94105, USA`.

identification_number.description: The user's document number, personal number, or tax number. For example, `123456789`.

ip_address.description: Expected IP address for the session. If the actual IP address differs from this value, a warning will be logged. For example, `192.168.1.100`.

contact_details.description: User contact information that can be used for notifications, prefilling verification forms, and phone verification. This includes email address, preferred language for communications, and phone number.

email.description: Email address of the user (e.g., "john.doe@example.com") that will be used during the Email Verification step. If not provided, the user must provide it during the verification flow.

email_lang.description: Language code (ISO 639-1) for email notifications. Controls the language of all email communications (e.g., "en", "es", "fr").

send_notification_emails.description: If true, sends verification status notifications for sessions requiring manual review to the provided email address.

phone.description: Phone number of the user in E.164 format if available (e.g., +14155552671).

callback.description: The callback URL of the session.

id_verification.description: The ID verification of the session.

front_image.description: URL of the front document image

front_video.description: URL of the front document video

back_image.description: URL of the back document image

back_video.description: URL of the back document video

full_front_image.description: URL of the full front document image

full_back_image.description: URL of the full back document image

age.description: Calculated age from date of birth

score.description: Confidence score of the liveness check

reference_image.description: URL of the reference image used

video_url.description: URL of the liveness check video

status.description: Status of the face match verification

score.description: Confidence score of the face match

source_image.description: URL of the source image used for comparison

target_image.description: URL of the target image used for comparison

full_number.description: Complete phone number with country prefix

type.description: Type of phone line (mobile, landline, etc)

is_disposable.description: Whether the phone number is from a disposable service

is_virtual.description: Whether the phone number is virtual

verification_method.description: Method used to verify the phone number

verified_at.description: Timestamp when the phone was verified

lifecycle.description: Chronological list of events in the phone verification lifecycle.

warnings.description: List of warnings related to phone verification

is_breached.description: Indicates if the email was found in known data breaches

breaches.description: List of known breaches this email was found in

logo_path.description: URL to the logo of the breached service

data_classes.description: Types of data exposed in the breach

breach_emails_count.description: Number of email addresses affected in the breach

is_disposable.description: Indicates if the email is from a disposable provider

is_undeliverable.description: Indicates if the email address is undeliverable

verification_attempts.description: Number of verification attempts for this email

verified_at.description: Timestamp when the email was verified

warnings.description: List of warnings related to email verification

lifecycle.description: Chronological list of events in the email verification lifecycle.

status.description: Status of the proof of address verification

document_file.description: URL of the proof of address document

issuing_state.description: Two-letter country code of the issuing state

document_type.description: Type of proof of address document

creation_date.description: Date when the document was created

modified_date.description: Date when the document was modified

issue_date.description: Date when the document was issued

poa_address.description: Raw address from the proof of address document

poa_formatted_address.description: Formatted address from the proof of address document

expected_details_parsed_address.description: Expected parsed address details for verification

order.description: Order of the item in the section

requires_text_input.description: Whether this choice requires additional text input

choices.description: Choices for dropdown or single choice elements

match.description: Whether this is a confirmed match

caption.description: Caption or title of the match

datasets.description: List of datasets where match was found

last_seen.description: Date when match was last seen

first_seen.description: Date when match was first seen

is_vpn_or_tor.description: Whether IP is from VPN or Tor network

is_data_center.description: Whether IP is from a data center

issuing_state.description: The country code of the issuing state.

validation_type.description: The type of database validation performed.

screened_data.description: The data screened during database validation.

validations.description: The results of the field validations.

match_type.description: The type of match found during validation.

status.description: The status of the database validation.

warnings.description: Warnings related to the database validation.

parameters.name: sessionId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the session for which to retrieve verification results.

parameters.name: x-api-key
parameters.description: The API Key for your application. You can obtain it by following the [Quick Start Guide](/reference/quick-start#/).

delete.description: The Delete Session API allows you to delete a verification session with all their data associated.

parameters.name: x-api-key
parameters.description: The API Key for your application. You can obtain it by following the [Quick Start Guide](/reference/quick-start#/).

get.description: The Generate PDF API allows you to generate a PDF report for a verification session.

parameters.name: x-api-key
parameters.description: The API Key for your application. You can obtain it by following the [Quick Start Guide](/reference/quick-start#/).

patch.description: The Update Status API allows you to update the status of a finished verification session programatically.

value.detail: Invalid status value. Must be 'Approved' or 'Declined'.

parameters.name: x-api-key
parameters.description: The API Key for your application. You can obtain it by following the [Quick Start Guide](/reference/quick-start#/).

new_status.description: The new status to set for the session. Can be `Approved` or `Declined`.

comment.description: A comment explaining the reason for the status change. For example `Duplicated user`.

post.description: The ID Verification API allows you to verify identity documents by submitting images of the document's front and back sides (when applicable). This API extracts and validates document information, performs authenticity checks, and returns structured data from the document.

warnings.long_description: The document's expiration date has passed, rendering it no longer valid for use.

long_description.example: The document's expiration date has passed, rendering it no longer valid for use.

value.error: You don't have enough credits to perform this request. Please top up at https://business.didit.me

parameters.name: x-api-key
parameters.description: The API Key for your application. You can obtain it by following the [Quick Start Guide](/reference/quick-start#/).

front_image.description: Front side image of the identity document. Allowed formats: JPEG, PNG, WebP, TIFF, PDF. Maximum file size: 5MB.

back_image.description: Back side image of the identity document, required for dual-sided documents like ID cards. Allowed formats: JPEG, PNG, WebP, TIFF, PDF. Maximum file size: 5MB.

perform_document_liveness.description: Whether or not to perform document liveness to make sure the imaged is not a screened copy, or portrait replacement.

minimum_age.description: Minimum age required. Users under this age will be declined. Must be between 1-120.

expiration_date_not_detected_action.description: Action to take when the expiration date is not detected. Must be one of `NO_ACTION` or `DECLINE`.

invalid_mrz_action.description: Action to take when MRZ reading fails because the MRZ has been tampered, or there is some occlusions that does not allow to read it properly. Must be one of `NO_ACTION` or `DECLINE`.

inconsistent_data_action.description: Action to take when the extracted data in the VIZ (Visual Inspection Zone) is not consistent with the MRZ data, indicating signs of data tampering. Must be one of `NO_ACTION` or `DECLINE`.

save_api_request.description: Whether to save this API request. If true, then it will appear on the `Manual Checks` section in the Business Console.

vendor_data.description: A unique identifier for the vendor or user, such as a UUID or email. This field enables proper session tracking and user data aggregation across multiple verification sessions.

post.description:
The Face Match API enables you to compare two facial images to determine if they belong to the same person. It is ideal for identity verification, access control, and user authentication.
**Note**: If multiple faces appear in an image, the API uses the face with the largest area to calculate the similarity score.

value.error: You don't have enough credits to perform this request. Please top up at https://business.didit.me

parameters.name: x-api-key
parameters.description: The API Key for your application. You can obtain it by following the [Quick Start Guide](/reference/quick-start#/).

user_image.description: User's face image to be verified. Allowed formats: JPEG, PNG, WebP, TIFF. Maximum file size: 5MB.

ref_image.description: Reference image to compare against. Allowed formats: JPEG, PNG, WebP, TIFF. Maximum file size: 5MB.

face_match_score_decline_threshold.description: Results with face match score below this will be declined. Must be between 0-100.

rotate_image.description: If true, attempts to rotate the input images in 90-degree increments (0, 90, 180, 270) to ensure the detected face is upright before performing the face match. **Note**: This is only recommended if you are unsure about the orientation of the face.

save_api_request.description: Whether to save this API request. If true, then it will appear on the `Manual Checks` section in the Business Console.

vendor_data.description: A unique identifier for the vendor or user, such as a UUID or email. This field enables proper session tracking and user data aggregation across multiple verification sessions.

post.description: The Age Estimation API allows you to estimate a person's age based on facial analysis. This API can be used for age verification, demographic analysis, or personalized user experiences. Additionally, we perform a passive liveness test to ensure the submitted image is of a real person and not a spoof attempt.

value.error: You don't have enough credits to perform this request. Please top up at https://business.didit.me

parameters.name: x-api-key
parameters.description: The API Key for your application. You can obtain it by following the [Quick Start Guide](/reference/quick-start#/).

user_image.description: User's face image to be age estimated. Allowed formats: JPEG, PNG, WebP, TIFF. Maximum file size: 5MB.

face_liveness_score_decline_threshold.description: Results with face liveness score below this will be declined. Must be between 0-100.

age_estimation_decline_threshold.description: Results with age estimation below this will be declined. Must be between 0-100.

rotate_image.description: If true, attempts to rotate the input images in 90-degree increments (0, 90, 180, 270) to ensure the detected face is upright before performing the face match. **Note**: This is only recommended if you are unsure about the orientation of the face.

save_api_request.description: Whether to save this API request. If true, then it will appear on the `Manual Checks` section in the Business Console.

vendor_data.description: A unique identifier for the vendor or user, such as a UUID or email. This field enables proper session tracking and user data aggregation across multiple verification sessions.

post.description: The Proof of Address (POA) Verification API allows you to verify address documents by submitting document images or PDFs. This API extracts and validates address information, performs authenticity checks, and returns structured data from the document.

poa.poa_formatted_address: Av. Monseñor Tavella 3396, A4400 Salta, Argentina

warnings.long_description: The submitted document is older than 90 days from its issue date, which exceeds the acceptable time period for validity.

creation_date.description: Date when the document was created

modified_date.description: Date when the document was modified

value.error: You don't have enough credits to perform this request. Please top up at https://business.didit.me

parameters.name: x-api-key
parameters.description: The API Key for your application. You can obtain it by following the [Quick Start Guide](/reference/quick-start#/).

document.description: Proof of address document. Allowed formats: PDF, JPEG, PNG, WebP, TIFF. Maximum file size: 15MB.

expected_address.description: Expected address to cross-validate with the data extracted in the POA document.

expected_country.description: Expected country to cross-validate with the data extracted in the POA document.

expected_first_name.description: Expected first name to cross-validate with the data extracted in the POA document.

expected_last_name.description: Expected last name to cross-validate with the data extracted in the POA document.

poa_languages_allowed.description: Comma-separated list of allowed language codes (e.g., `en,es,fr`). If blank or not provided, defaults are used. You can find a list of supported languages [here](/identity-verification/supported-languages).

poa_document_age_months.description: Comma-separated key:value pairs for document age limits (e.g., `utility_bill:3,bank_statement:3`). If blank or not provided, defaults are used.

poa_name_mismatch_action.description: Action to take when there is a mismatch between the name provided (first name, last name, or both), and the extracted name from the POA document. Must be one of `NO_ACTION` or `DECLINE`.

poa_document_issues_action.description: Action to take when the document quality or file integrity is poor. Must be one of `NO_ACTION` or `DECLINE`.

poa_document_authenticity_action.description: Action to take when document manipulation or authenticity is suspected. Must be one of `NO_ACTION` or `DECLINE`.

poa_unsupported_language_action.description: Action to take when the document language is not supported. Must be one of `NO_ACTION` or `DECLINE`.

poa_address_mismatch_action.description: Action to take when there is a mismatch between the expected address and the address extracted from the POA document. Must be one of `NO_ACTION` or `DECLINE`.

poa_issuer_not_identified_action.description: Action to take when the issuer is not identified. Must be one of `NO_ACTION` or `DECLINE`.

save_api_request.description: Whether to save this API request. If true, then it will appear on the `Manual Checks` section in the Business Console.

vendor_data.description: A unique identifier for the vendor or user, such as a UUID or email. This field enables proper session tracking and user data aggregation across multiple verification sessions.

post.description: The AML Screening API allows you to screen individuals against global watchlists and high-risk databases. This API provides real-time screening capabilities to detect potential matches and mitigate risks associated with financial fraud and terrorism.

parameters.name: x-api-key
parameters.description: The API Key for your application. You can obtain it by following the [Quick Start Guide](/reference/quick-start#/).

full_name.description: Full name of the person to be screened.

date_of_birth.description: Date of birth of the person to be screened with format: YYYY-MM-DD. For example, `1990-05-15`.

nationality.description: Nationality of the person to be screened with format ISO 3166-1 alpha-2. For example: `ES`.

document_number.description: Document number of the person to be screened.

aml_score_approve_threshold.description: Results with aml score score above this will be declined. Must be between 0-100.

include_adverse_media.description: Wheter to include adverse media in the screening. If included, the request will take approximately 10 seconds.

include_ongoing_monitoring.description: Whether to include ongoing monitoring in the screening. If included, the save_api_request must be included as well, otherwise it will raise an error.

save_api_request.description: Whether to save this API request. If true, then it will appear on the `Manual Checks` section in the Business Console.

vendor_data.description: A unique identifier for the vendor or user, such as a UUID or email. This field enables proper session tracking and user data aggregation across multiple verification sessions.

post.description: The Face Search API allows you to search for faces in a database of previously verified faces. This API can be used for identity verification, access control, and user authentication.

warnings.long_description: The system identified a face in the blocklist, which means the face is not allowed to be verified.

long_description.example: The system identified a face in the blocklist, which means the face is not allowed to be verified.

value.error: No face detected in the image
You don't have enough credits to perform this request. Please top up at https://business.didit.me

parameters.name: x-api-key
parameters.description: The API Key for your application. You can obtain it by following the [Quick Start Guide](/reference/quick-start#/).

user_image.description: User's face image to be searched for similarities in previous approved sessions. Allowed formats: JPEG, PNG, WebP, TIFF. Maximum file size: 5MB.

search_type.description: Search type for face search. Must be between `most_similar` or `blocklisted_or_approved`.

rotate_image.description: If true, attempts to rotate the input images in 90-degree increments (0, 90, 180, 270) to ensure the detected face is upright before performing the face match. **Note**: This is only recommended if you are unsure about the orientation of the face.

save_api_request.description: Whether to save this API request. If true, then it will appear on the `Manual Checks` section in the Business Console.

vendor_data.description: A unique identifier for the vendor or user, such as a UUID or email. This field enables proper session tracking and user data aggregation across multiple verification sessions.

get.description: The List Sessions API retrieves a list of verification session results for your application. You can filter the results using optional query parameters, such as `vendor_data`, to narrow down the sessions returned.

parameters.name: vendor_data
parameters.description: A unique identifier for the vendor or user, such as a UUID or email. This field enables proper session tracking and user data aggregation across multiple verification sessions.

parameters.name: country
parameters.description: ISO 3166-1 alpha-3 country code representing the country of the country of the applicant's ID document, which may differ from nationality. For example, `GBR`.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: The status of the verification session. For a complete list of possible verification statuses, refer to the [Verification Statuses](/reference/verification-statuses/) page.

parameters.name: workflow_id
parameters.description: The identifier of the verification workflow to filter sessions by. You can find this ID on the Workflows page in the Console.

parameters.name: x-api-key
parameters.description: The API Key for your application. You can obtain it by following the [Quick Start Guide](/reference/quick-start#/).

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The number of items to skip before starting to return results.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of items to return in the response.

post.description: Didit's Share KYC via API feature enables trusted partners to securely share user verification data. This is ideal for scenarios where a user is onboarded on one platform and needs to access a partner service, eliminating the need for the user to undergo the verification process again. This business-to-business sharing streamlines user experience across integrated services. Learn more at [Share KYC via API](/reference/share-kyc-via-api#/).

value.detail: You do not have permission to perform this action.

parameters.name: x-api-key
parameters.description: The API Key for your application. You can obtain it by following the [Quick Start Guide](/reference/quick-start#/).

for_application_id.description: The application ID to share the session with. You can find this in the settings of your application in the Business Console.

ttl_in_seconds.description: The time to live for the share token in seconds. Minimum 60 seconds, maximum 86400 seconds (24 hours).

post.description: The Import Shared Session API is used by partners to import shared verification sessions for Reusable KYC. Learn more at [Share KYC via API](/reference/share-kyc-via-api#/).

value.detail: You do not have permission to perform this action.

parameters.name: x-api-key
parameters.description: The API Key for your application. You can obtain it by following the [Quick Start Guide](/reference/quick-start#/).

share_token.description: The share token to import the session with.

trust_review.description: Whether to trust the review of the session to be imported. If true, the session will be imported as is, otherwise the session will be set to 'In Review' so it can be reviewed by the application.

workflow_id.description: The workflow ID to import the session with.

vendor_data.description: Sets your own user vendor_data for the imported verification session.

post.description: The passive liveness API allows you to verify that a user is physically present by analyzing a captured image without requiring any explicit movement or interaction from the user.

value.error: You don't have enough credits to perform this request. Please top up at https://business.didit.me

parameters.name: x-api-key
parameters.description: The API Key for your application. You can obtain it by following the [Quick Start Guide](/reference/quick-start#/).

user_image.description: User's face image to perform the passive liveness. Allowed formats: JPEG, PNG, WebP, TIFF. Maximum file size: 5MB.

face_liveness_score_decline_threshold.description: Results with liveness score below this will be declined. Must be between 0-100.

rotate_image.description: If true, attempts to rotate the input images in 90-degree increments (0, 90, 180, 270) to ensure the detected face is upright before performing the face match. Note: This is only recommended if you are unsure about the orientation of the face.

save_api_request.description: Whether to save this API request. If true, then it will appear on the `Manual Checks` section in the Business Console.

vendor_data.description: A unique identifier for the vendor or user, such as a UUID or email. This field enables proper session tracking and user data aggregation across multiple verification sessions.

post.description: The Database Validation API allows you to validate user-provided identity data against authoritative national and global data sources. Supporting both 1x1 and 2x2 matching methods, this API uses a waterfall approach to maximize match rates by sequentially querying multiple providers until a full, conclusive match is found. It enables real-time identity verification, helping you reduce fraud, streamline onboarding, and ensure compliance with regulatory requirements.

value.error: You don't have enough credits to perform this request. Please top up at https://business.didit.me

parameters.name: x-api-key
parameters.description: The API Key for your application. You can obtain it by following the [Quick Start Guide](/reference/quick-start#/).

issuing_state.description: The ISO 3166-1 alpha-3 country code of the issuing state. Determines which validation sources are used.

validation_type.description: The type of matching to perform: '1x1' for single-database matching or '2x2' for dual-database matching.

first_name.description: The individual's first name. Might be required for some countries and matching types.

last_name.description: The individual's last name. Might be required for some countries and matching types.

date_of_birth.description: The individual's date of birth in YYYY-m-d format. Might be required for some countries and matching types. Example: 1990-01-01.

personal_number.description: A government-issued unique personal identifier (e.g., national ID number). Might be required for some countries and matching types.

tax_number.description: The individual's tax identification number, where applicable.

document_number.description: The number of an official document such as a passport or national ID. Might be required for some countries and matching types.

nationality.description: The individual's nationality, expressed as an ISO 3166-1 alpha-3 country code. Might be required for some countries and matching types.

address.description: The individual's residential address. Used in specific jurisdictions where address validation is supported. Might be required for some countries and matching types.

save_api_request.description: Whether to save this API request. If true, then it will appear on the `Manual Checks` section in the Business Console.

vendor_data.description: A unique identifier for the vendor or user, such as a UUID or email. This field enables proper session tracking and user data aggregation across multiple verification sessions.

post.description: This endpoint sends a one-time verification code to a specified phone number. It automatically handles blocked numbers and supports a single retry in case the initial attempt fails. Retries are free of charge. The verification code remains valid for 5 minutes from the time it is sent.

phone_number.description: The phone number to verify in E.164 format. e.g. +14155552671

options.description: Options for the phone verification, such as code_size, locale, and preferred_channel.

code_size.description: The number of digits for the verification code. Minimum 4, maximum 8.

locale.description: The locale to use for the verification message. e.g. en-US

preferred_channel.description: Specifies the preferred channel for delivering the verification message (e.g., whatsapp). If the selected channel is unavailable for the country or phone number, the message will automatically be sent via SMS as a fallback.

signals.description: A dictionary of signals for fraud detection. Keys are signal names (string) and values are signal values (string).

ip.description: The IP address of the user's device. Supports both IPv4 and IPv6. Example: '192.0.2.1' or '2001:0db8:85a3:0000:0000:8a2e:0370:7334'.

device_id.description: The unique identifier for the user's device. For Android, this is ANDROID_ID; for iOS, identifierForVendor. Example: '8F0B8FDD-C2CB-4387-B20A-56E9B2E5A0D2'.

device_platform.description: The type of the user's device. One of: android, ios, ipados, tvos, web. Example: 'ios'.

device_model.description: The model of the user's device. Example: 'iPhone17,2'.

os_version.description: The version of the user's device operating system. Example: '18.0.1'.

app_version.description: The version of your application. Example: '1.2.34'.

user_agent.description: The user agent of the user's device. Example: 'Mozilla/5.0 (iPhone; CPU iPhone OS 14_4 like Mac OS X) AppleWebKit/605.1.15 (KHTML, like Gecko) Version/14.0.3 Mobile/15E148 Safari/604.1'.

vendor_data.description: A unique identifier for the vendor or user, such as a UUID or email. This field enables proper session tracking and user data aggregation across multiple verification sessions.

reason.description: Reason for the status (only applies to 'Undeliverable').

value.detail: Maximum verification attempts reached for this phone number. Only 4 authentication attempts are allowed per hour. Try again later or use a different number.

parameters.name: x-api-key
parameters.description: The API Key for your application.

post.description: This endpoint verifies a one-time code sent to a phone number and returns information about the number. There is a maximum of three verification attempts per code.

phone_number.description: The phone number to verify in E.164 format. e.g. +14155552671

code.description: The verification code sent to the phone number. Must be between 4 and 8 characters in length.

duplicated_phone_number_action.description: Action to take for duplicated phone numbers

disposable_number_action.description: Action to take for disposable phone numbers

voip_number_action.description: Action to take for VoIP phone numbers

status.description: Status of the check operation (e.g., 'Approved', 'Failed', 'Expired or Not Found').

message.description: A human-readable message about the check outcome.

status.description: Overall status of the phone verification process.

full_number.description: Complete phone number with country prefix.

type.description: Type of phone line (mobile, landline, etc).

is_disposable.description: Whether the phone number is from a disposable service.

is_virtual.description: Whether the phone number is virtual.

verification_method.description: Method used to verify the phone number.

verified_at.description: Timestamp when the phone was verified.

lifecycle.description: Chronological list of events in the phone verification lifecycle.

warnings.description: List of warnings related to phone verification.

created_at.description: Timestamp when the phone verification session was created.

post.description: This endpoint sends a one-time verification code to a specified email address. locale.description: The locale to use for the verification message. e.g. en-US

user_agent.description: The user agent of the user's device. Example: 'Mozilla/5.0 (iPhone; CPU iPhone OS 14_4 like Mac OS X) AppleWebKit/605.1.15 (KHTML, like Gecko) Version/14.0.3 Mobile/15E148 Safari/604.1'.

breached_email_action.description: Action to take for breached email addresses

is_undeliverable.description: Indicates if the email address is undeliverable

verification_attempts.description: Number of verification attempts for this email

warnings.description: List of warnings related to email verification

lifecycle.description: Chronological list of events in the email verification lifecycle.

created_at.description: Timestamp when the email verification session was created.
